info.title: Tasklist REST API
info.description: Tasklist is a ready-to-use API application to rapidly implement business processes alongside user tasks in Zeebe.

tags.name: Task
tags.description: API to query and manage tasks.

post.description:
This operation performs several actions:
  1. Validates the task and draft variables.
  2. Deletes existing draft variables for the task.
  3. Checks for new draft variables. If a new variable's `name` matches an existing one but the `value` differs, it is saved. In case of duplicate draft variable names, the last variable's value is kept.
NOTE:
  • Invoking this method successively will overwrite all existing draft variables. Only draft variables submitted in the most recent request body will be persisted. Therefore, ensure you include all necessary variables in each request to maintain the intended variable set.
  • The UI does not currently display the values for draft variables that are created via this endpoint.

400.description:
An error is returned when the task is not active (not in the `CREATED` state).
An error is returned if the task was not claimed (assigned) before, except the case when JWT authentication token used.
An error is returned if the task is not assigned to the current user, except the case when JWT authentication token used.

404.description: An error is returned when the task with the `taskId` is not found.

500.description: An error is returned if an unexpected error occurs while persisting draft task variables.

post.description:
This method returns a list of task variables for the specified `taskId` and `variableName`.
If the request body is not provided or if the `variableNames` parameter in the request is empty, all variables associated with the task will be returned.

404.description: An error is returned when the task with the `taskId` is not found.

post.description:
Returns the list of tasks that satisfy search request params.
  • If an empty body is provided, all tasks are returned.
  • Only one of `[searchAfter, searchAfterOrEqual, searchBefore, searchBeforeOrEqual]` search options must be present in request.

400.description: An error is returned when more than one search parameters among `[searchAfter, searchAfterOrEqual, searchBefore, searchBeforeOrEqual]` are present in request

patch.description: Unassign a task with `taskId`. Returns the task.

400.description:
An error is returned when the task is not active (not in the CREATED state).
An error is returned if the task was not claimed (assigned) before.

404.description: An error is returned when the task with the `taskId` is not found.

patch.description: Complete a task with `taskId` and optional `variables`. Returns the task.

400.description:
An error is returned when the task is not active (not in the CREATED state).
An error is returned if the task was not claimed (assigned) before.
An error is returned if the task is not assigned to the current user.

403.description: User has no permission to access the task (Self-managed only).

404.description: An error is returned when the task with the `taskId` is not found.

patch.description: Assign a task with `taskId` to `assignee` or the active user. Returns the task.

requestBody.description: When using REST API with JWT authentication token following request body parameters may be used.

400.description:
An error is returned when the task is not active (not in the CREATED state).
An error is returned when task was already assigned, except the case when JWT authentication token used and `allowOverrideAssignment = true`.

403.description: An error is returned when user doesn't have the permission to assign another user to this task.

404.description: An error is returned when the task with the `taskId` is not found.

get.description: Get the variable details by variable id.

404.description: An error is returned when the variable with the `variableId` is not found.

get.description: Get one task by id. Returns task or error when task does not exist.

404.description: An error is returned when the task with the `taskId` is not found.

403.description: User has no permission to access the task (Self-managed only).

get.description: Get the form details by `formId` and `processDefinitionKey` required query param. The `version` query param is optional and is used only for deployed forms (if empty, it retrieves the highest version).

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version of the form. Valid only for deployed forms.

404.description: An error is returned when the form with the `formId` and `processDefinitionKey` is not found.

variables.description: The variables to complete the user task with.

action.description: A custom action value that will be accessible from user task events resulting from this endpoint invocation. If not provided, it will default to "complete".

assignee.description: The assignee for the user task. The assignee must not be empty or `null`.

allowOverride.description: By default, the task is reassigned if it was already assigned. Set this to `false` to return an error in such cases. The task must then first be unassigned to be assigned again. Use this when you have users picking from group task queues to prevent race conditions.

action.description: A custom action value that will be accessible from user task events resulting from this endpoint invocation. If not provided, it will default to "assign".

status.description: An integer that represents the HTTP status code of the error response. For example, 400 indicates a 'Bad Request' error, 404 indicates a 'Not Found' error, and so on.

message.description: A string that provides a brief description of the error that occurred.

instance.description: Error instance UUID for lookup (e.g., in log messages).

value.description: The value of the variable. When specifying the variable value, it's crucial to maintain consistency with JSON values (serialization for the complex objects such as list) and ensure that strings remain appropriately formatted.

alwaysReturnFullValue.description: Always return the full value of the variable?

VariablesSearchRequest.description: Request object to search tasks variables by provided variable names.

isValueTruncated.description: Does the `previewValue` contain the truncated value or full value?

previewValue.description: A preview of the variable's value. Limited in size.

id.description: The unique identifier of the variable.

isValueTruncated.description: Does the `previewValue` contain the truncated value or full value?

previewValue.description: A preview of the variable's value. Limited in size.

draft.description: The draft value of the variable.

from.description: Start date range to search from in date-time format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339 profile of the ISO 8601 standard.

to.description: End date range to search to in date-time format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339 profile of the ISO 8601 standard.

gte.description: Value greater than or equals to.

lte.description: Value less than or equals to.

value.description: The value of the variable. When specifying the variable value, it's crucial to maintain consistency with JSON values (serialization for the complex objects such as list) and ensure that strings remain appropriately formatted.

operator.description:
The comparison operator to use for the variable.
* `eq`: Equals

TaskOrderBy.description: Sort results by a specific field.

TaskSearchRequest.description: Request object to search tasks by provided params.

assignee.description: Who is assigned to the tasks?

assignees.description: The assignee is one of the given assignees.

candidateGroup.description: Given group is in candidate groups list.

candidateGroups.description: At least one of the given groups is in candidate groups list.

candidateUser.description: Given user is in candidate user list.

candidateUsers.description: At least one of the given users is in candidate user list.

processDefinitionKey.description: Reference to process definition (renamed equivalent of TaskQuery.processDefinitionId field).

processInstanceKey.description: Reference to process instance (renamed equivalent of TaskQuery.processInstanceId field)

followUpDate.description: A range of follow-up dates for the tasks to search for.

dueDate.description: A range of due dates for the tasks to search for.

priority.description: The conditions applied on priority field.

id.description: The unique identifier of the task.

taskDefinitionId.description: User Task ID from the BPMN definition.

creationDate.description: When was the task created (renamed equivalent of `Task.creationTime` field).

completionDate.description: When was the task completed (renamed equivalent of `Task.completionTime` field).

assignee.description: The username/id of who is assigned to the task.

isFirst.description: A flag to show that the task is first in the current filter.

formId.description: Reference to the ID of a deployed form. If the form is not deployed, this property is null.

formVersion.description: Reference to the version of a deployed form. If the form is not deployed, this property is null.

isFormEmbedded.description: Is the form embedded for this task? If there is no form, this property is null.

processDefinitionKey.description: Reference to process definition (renamed equivalent of `Task.processDefinitionId` field).

processInstanceKey.description: Reference to process instance id (renamed equivalent of `Task.processInstanceId` field).

tenantId.description: The tenant ID associated with the task.

dueDate.description: The due date for the task.

followUpDate.description: The follow-up date for the task.

context.description: The context variable (from modeler) of the task.

priority.description: The assigned priority of the task. Only for Zeebe User Tasks.

Changeset.description: JSON object with changed task attribute values.  The following attributes can be adjusted with this endpoint, additional attributes will be ignored:  * `candidateGroups` - reset by providing an empty list * `candidateUsers` - reset by providing an empty list * `dueDate` - reset by providing an empty String * `followUpDate` - reset by providing an empty String * `priority` - minimum 0, maximum 100, default 50  Providing any of those attributes with a `null` value or omitting it preserves the persisted attribute's value.  The assignee cannot be adjusted with this endpoint, use the Assign task endpoint. This ensures correct event emission for assignee changes.

dueDate.description: The due date of the task. Reset by providing an empty String.

followUpDate.description: The follow-up date of the task. Reset by providing an empty String.

candidateUsers.description: The list of candidate users of the task. Reset by providing an empty list.

candidateGroups.description: The list of candidate groups of the task. Reset by providing an empty list.

action.description: A custom action value that will be accessible from user task events resulting from this endpoint invocation. If not provided, it will default to "update".

id.description: The unique identifier of the task.

taskDefinitionId.description: User Task ID from the BPMN definition.

creationDate.description: When was the task created (renamed equivalent of `Task.creationTime` field).

completionDate.description: When was the task completed (renamed equivalent of `Task.completionTime` field).

assignee.description: The username/id of who is assigned to the task.

formId.description: Reference to the ID of a deployed form. If the form is not deployed, this property is null.

formVersion.description: Reference to the version of a deployed form. If the form is not deployed, this property is null.

isFormEmbedded.description: Is the form embedded for this task? If there is no form, this property is null.

processDefinitionKey.description: Reference to process definition (renamed equivalent of `Task.processDefinitionId` field).

processInstanceKey.description: Reference to process instance id (renamed equivalent of `Task.processInstanceId` field).

tenantId.description: The tenant ID associated with the task.

dueDate.description: The due date for the task.

followUpDate.description: The follow-up date for the task.

priority.description: The assigned priority of the task. Only for Zeebe User Tasks.

TaskCompleteRequest.description: Request object with variables to update or add to task during the task completion.

variables.description: Variables to update or add to task during the task completion

TaskAssignRequest.description: Request params used to assign the task to assignee or current user.

assignee.description:
When using a JWT token, the assignee parameter is NOT optional when called directly from the API.
The system will not be able to detect the assignee from the JWT token, therefore the assignee parameter needs to be
explicitly passed in this instance.

allowOverrideAssignment.description:
When `true` the task that is already assigned may be assigned again. Otherwise the task
must be first unassigned and only then assigned again.

value.description: The full value of the variable

draft.description: The draft value of the variable

tenantId.description: The tenant ID associated with the variable

BrokerInfo.description: Provides information on a broker node.

nodeId.description: The unique (within a cluster) node ID for the broker.

host.description: The hostname for reaching the broker.

port.description: The port for reaching the broker.

partitions.description: A list of partitions managed or replicated on this broker.

Partition.description: Provides information on a partition within a broker node.

partitionId.description: The unique ID of this partition.

role.description: Describes the Raft role of the broker for a given partition.

health.description: Describes the current health of the partition.

TopologyResponse.description: The response of a topology request.

brokers.description: A list of brokers that are part of this cluster.

clusterSize.description: The number of brokers in the cluster.

partitionsCount.description: The number of partitions are spread across the cluster.

replicationFactor.description: The configured replication factor for this cluster.

gatewayVersion.description: The version of the Zeebe Gateway.

id.description: The unique identifier of the embedded form within one process.

processDefinitionKey.description: Reference to process definition (renamed equivalent of `Form.processDefinitionId` field).

version.description: The version field is null in the case of an embedded form, while it represents the deployed form's version in other scenarios.

tenantId.description: The tenant ID associated with the form.

isDeleted.description: Indicates whether the deployed form is deleted or not on Zeebe. This field is false by default, in the case of an embedded form.

cookie.description: Cookie-based authentication is only available on Self-Managed clusters.
cookie.name: TASKLIST-SESSION
